layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.head.title: layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.body.p:87-3
layer_tilemap_exists: You can use this function to check and see if a tile map element exists on any given layer. You supply the layer ID (which you get when you create the layer using layer_create()) or the layer name (as a string - this will have a performance impact) and the tile map element ID (which you get when you create a tile map element using layer_tilemap_create() or when you use the function layer_tilemap_get_id()) and the function will return either true if the element exists, or false if it does not.

layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.head.title: layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.body.p:90-3
layer_tilemap_exists: NOTE: This function works within the scope of the current target room - by default the room in which the function is called - which can be set using the function layer_set_target_room().

layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.head.title: layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:102-9
layer_tilemap_exists: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)

layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.head.title: layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:106-9
layer_tilemap_exists: The unique ID value of the tile map element to check

layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.head.title: layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.body.p:115-3
layer_tilemap_exists:
{ANY_CODE} var lay_id = layer_get_id("tilemap_trees");
if layer_tilemap_exists(lay_id, global.Treestilemap)
{nbsp_x4}{
{nbsp_x4}layer_tilemap_destroy(lay_id, global.Treestilemap);
{nbsp_x4}}

layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.head.title: layer_tilemap_exists.htm+html.body.p:118-3
layer_tilemap_exists: The above code checks the layer "tilemap_trees" to see if the given tile map element exists and if it does, then it is destroyed (but not the layer).
